title: Rio Tinto stock plunges on mega merger talks with Swiss mining giant | Finance Report | ABC NEWS
description: Rio Tinto is having early discussions with Glencore about a potential merger to dominate the world's copper market.  If it proceeds, they will become the world's largest mining company, worth over $300 billion.  Meanwhile, the odds of an interest rate hike have dropped slightly after traders had an opportunity to digest Reserve Bank deputy governor Andrew Hauser's wide-ranging interview with the ABC, as finance presenter David Chau explains. title: NT pokies clubs claim member perks, lavish upgrades as 'community' benefits | ABC NEWS
description: Community clubs in the Northern Territory claim they return millions in pokies profits to the community, but until now, what form those contributions took has been hidden from view.   Documents released to the ABC under Freedom of Information laws reveal much of it was actually spent upgrading the clubs' own hospitality venues and providing free perks for their members.   Some even claimed donations made by members of the public via charity tins on club bars which had no connection with their poker machine profits. The NT government says requiring community clubs to pay a 10 per cent cash levy like pubs and casinos may make some financially unviable.   Jason Walls has this report for Stateline Northern Territory. title: NSW premier doesn't rule out state inquiry into Bondi attack | ABC NEWS
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is continuing to field criticism over his response to the Bondi terror attack, a day after calling a national royal commission into antisemitism and social cohesion. While NSW has abandoned its own state-led inquiry, Premier Chris Minns admits further investigations may be necessary. title: Catastrophic weather causes bushfire chaos in Victoria | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 Multiple out-of-control bushfires are threatening dozens of towns in central and north-eastern Victoria, as well as communities near the regional hub of Horsham in the state's west. 00:54 A fire near the Central-Victorian town of Longwood is thought to have already destroyed up to 20 homes, with two adults and a child unaccounted for. 03:41 Angus Verley reports from Horsham where a major fire has threatened the town. 04:32 Nicole Asher reports from an evacuation centre in the town of Seymour on the latest from the central Victorian fires. 05:33 Ashlee Aldridge reports from Tallangatta near the NSW border where wind conditions may shift the fire front direction early Saturday morning. 07:30 The small community of Ruffy is facing heartache, after the Longwood fire tore through the town with up to 20 homes destroyed, including the school and the general store. 09:18 ABC meteorologist Adam Morgan discusses the catastrophic weather conditions hitting the state, and what to expect in the next 24 hours. 10:32 The Country Fire Authority's Chief Officer Jason Heffernan discusses what emergency crews are most concerned about as the fires continue overnight. title: White House ramps up push to control Greenland | ABC NEWS
description: French President Emmanuel Macron has accused the US of turning its back on its NATO allies.
